content.question: The scenario that best describes out-group homogeneity bias is

choices.label: Mr. Kinnear tends to hire less qualified family members instead of more qualified nonfamily members at his place of business.
Mary laughs a lot when she is around people she is close too, but around strangers she restrains her laughter even when she finds something funny.
Mark believes that people from a different culture dress inappropriately and looks down on those people because of how they dress.
Kara, who plays soccer, notices the uniqueness of her soccer teammates, but she thinks all basketball players are the same.

content.answer: Kara, who plays soccer, notices the uniqueness of her soccer teammates, but she thinks all basketball players are the same.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
